end.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

links.description: Like The Last Emperor, costume colour is intrinsic to The Favourite’s themes. While crimson and orange represent the majesty and innocence of the Emperor’s childhood, the black and white costumes in The Favourite represent courtly intrigue and symbolise chess pieces.

end.brief_description: Slaking a thirst for dangerous games, Kathryn challenges her stepbrother, Sebastian, to deflower their headmaster’s daughter before the summer ends. If he succeeds, the prize is the chance to bed Kathryn. But if he loses, Kathryn will claim his most prized possession.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

links.description: The seductive tale of backstabbing set among high society was transported from pre-Revolution Paris to Manhattan in 1999 American teen movie update, Cruel Intentions. Actor Swoosie Kurtz also appears in both films.

end.title: Riverdale
end.creator_credit: Rebekka Sorensen, Amy Myrold, Arabella Anderson, Brian E. Paterson, Janine Salinas Schoenberg, Jennifer Lence, Scott Graham, Archie Comics, CBS Studios and Dustin Farrell
end.brief_description: Set in the present, the series offers a bold, subversive take on Archie, Betty, Veronica and their friends, exploring the surreality of small-town life, the darkness and weirdness bubbling beneath Riverdale’s wholesome facade.

links.description: Cruel Intentions is considered an R-rated (in America) b-grade or cult masterpiece depending on who you ask, but its influence is undeniable. The dark drama portrayed teens as being amoral, predatory and sexual, qualities that modern shows like Riverdale explore.

end.title: Dangerous Liaisons
end.creator_credit: Gladys de Segonzac and Robert Guisgand
end.brief_description: Juliette Merteuil and Valmont is a sophisticated couple, always looking for fun and excitement. Both have sexual affairs with others and share their experiences with one another. But there is one rule: never fall in love. But this time Valmont falls madly in love with a girl he meets at a ski resort, Marianne.

links.description: Though the Stephen Frears’s Oscar-winning 1988 version of Dangerous Liaisons is the most famous, the first adaptation of Choderlos de Laclos’ novel is Roger Vadim’s French version from 1959, starring Jeanne Moreau and Gérard Philipe.
